elements.title: a monument near its former headquarters
elements.contents: ... that 120 years after the founding of the world's first homosexual organization in 1897, a monument near its former headquarters (pictured) was unveiled in Berlin?

elements.title: Paul R. Howe
elements.contents: ... that Paul R. Howe was first on the scene in the real-life "Black Hawk Down"?

elements.title: The Space Museum
elements.contents: ... that before writing The Space Museum, Glyn Jones had never seen Doctor Who?

elements.title: Sylvestre Bangui
elements.contents: ... that whilst serving as the Central African ambassador in Paris, Sylvestre Bangui held a press conference confirming that his government had massacred children and resigned?

elements.title: Professional Esports Association
elements.contents: ... that the Professional Esports Association suspended its plans for a Counter-Strike: Global Offensive league four months after its announcement?

elements.title: Maureen Harding Clark
elements.contents: ... that the Irish judge Maureen Harding Clark studied Malay in Malaysia and French in France before she was appointed to the Khmer Rouge Tribunal by King Norodom Sihamoni?

elements.title: Palácio das Cinzas
elements.contents: ... that in 2006 The New York Times described the Palácio das Cinzas, then the presidential palace of East Timor, as "a glorified bungalow really"?

elements.title: Embassy Theatre
elements.contents: ... that Gloria Gould, the manager of New York City's Embassy Theatre, wanted an all-woman staff because women "were more efficient than men"?
